unnormalised: A property dispute took a dramatic turn in Chennai earlier today. Seems like Mr. R. Kumar, residing at 12, 1st Cross St., Adyar, filed a case against his neighbour, Mrs. P. Iyer, over a 2 ft strip of land.
normalised: A property dispute took a dramatic turn in Chennai earlier today. Seems like Mister R. Kumar, residing at twelve, first Cross Street, Adyar, filed a case against his neighbour, Missus P. Iyer, over a two feet strip of land.

unnormalised: The local court, after hearing arguments from Adv. Sharma representing Mr. Kumar and Adv. Menon for Mrs. Iyer, has ordered a stay on any construction activity on the disputed area until 10/11/2024. Sources say the contested land is worth approx. â‚¹5 Lakhs, and both parties claim it's part of their property. Civil Case No. 45/2023 has everyone talking, let me tell you!
normalised: The local court, after hearing arguments from Advocate Sharma representing Mister Kumar and Advocate Menon for Missus Iyer, has ordered a stay on any construction activity on the disputed area until tenth november two thousand and twenty four. Sources say the contested land is worth approximately rupee five lakhs, and both parties claim it's part of their property. Civil Case Number forty five slash two thousand and twenty three has everyone talking, let me tell you!

unnormalised: This isn't the 1st time such a thing has happened in Chennai, bhai. Land disputes are common here, especially with property prices soaring. Hopefully, they can sort it out before Diwali next month. Else, it will become a long legal battle.
normalised: This isn't the first time such a thing has happened in Chennai, bhai. Land disputes are common here, especially with property prices soaring. Hopefully, they can sort it out before Diwali next month. Else, it will become a long legal battle.
